alert.note: Alert for Northern Jasper; Northern Newton; Northern Orange; Southern Jasper; Southern Newton; Southern Orange (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lake Charles (Southeast Texas and Southwest Louisiana)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued September 30 at 8:05PM CDT until October 02 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: ...Red Flag Warning for portions of Southeast Texas, Central and Southern Louisiana again Sunday... .Relative humidity values between 25 and 35 percent with highs in the mid to upper 90s can be expected again on Sunday, then return for another day on Monday. Meanwhile, fuels in this area are extremely dry due to the ongoing exceptional drought. This combined with sustained 20 foot winds from the east to east- northeast at 7 to 12 mph with gusts to 20 mph will favor initiation and rapid spread of wildland fires. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM TO 8 PM CDT SUNDAY FOR LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY AND DRY FUELS FOR PORTIONS OF SOUTHEAST TEXAS, CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN LOUISIANA... ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM TO 8 PM CDT MONDAY FOR LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY AND DRY FUELS FOR PORTIONS OF SOUTHEAST TEXAS, CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN LOUISIANA... * AFFECTED AREA...Vernon, Rapides, Avoyelles, Beauregard, Allen, Evangeline, St. Landry, Lafayette, Upper St. Martin, Northern Calcasieu, Northern Jefferson Davis, Northern Acadia, Southern Calcasieu, Southern Jefferson Davis, Southern Acadia, Northern Jasper, Northern Newton, Southern Jasper, Southern Newton, Northern Orange and Southern Orange. * TIMING...1000 AM CDT until 800 PM CDT on Sunday, and 1000 AM CDT until 800 PM CDT on Monday. * WINDS...East 5 to 10 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 25 percent. * TEMPERATURES...mid to upper 90s. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

area.areaDesc: Northern Jasper; Northern Newton; Northern Orange; Southern Jasper; Southern Newton; Southern Orange
